examples: The movie trailer piqued my interest in the film.
Her comment about my work piqued my anger.
She piqued herself on her cooking skills.
I was piqued by his rude remark.
He was piqued by her lack of attention.

words.defineVi: khéo léo trong việc sử dụng đôi tay

examples: A slight question mark against her character remains.
Oh, I don't have the slightest idea.
She loved the slight bitterness of endive, which added complexity to her dish.
He's extremely irritable - he flies off the handle at the slightest thing.
The speaker's slight stuttering did not detract from the power of her message, as a diamond with a flaw is better than a common stone that is perfect.
words.defineEn: not a lot in amount, size, or extent
words.defineVi: không nhiều về số lượng, kích thước hoặc mức độ

examples: A figurehead for the responsibility of expressing what's going on right now.
And Mondale expanded the traditional role of vice president from figurehead to partner.
The Democrats were formed in the 1820s with Andrew Jackson as their figurehead, who would later become president.
And while Louis remained as the figurehead of the constitutional monarchy, he feared for his future.
In 1980, Thomas took on more of a figurehead role as senior chairman in 1985.
words.defineEn: a person used as a cover for some questionable activity
words.defineVi: một người được sử dụng làm vỏ bọc cho một số hoạt động đáng ngờ

examples: This is the figurative definition.
It's not a real paralysis, it's a figurative term.
Artists are thinking abstractly and figurative, trying to blur the lines between them.

There are many extremely affecting memorials that are figurative, including German artist Käthe Kollwitz’s 1920 woodcut
words.defineEn: using language in a way that words don't have their actual meaning, but an imaginative meaning instead

examples: And if they're smallish, they're called buttes.

examples: And so the president goes to Kenosha to buttress that.
So we have no disagreement about the need to buttress Social Security, get more revenue into the program.
Pointed arches, flying buttresses, and large windows made the structure more skeletal and ornate.

Until the opinion was buttressed by intelligency, it was very hard for us to talk about publicly.
words.defineEn: make stronger or defensible
words.defineVi: làm cho mạnh mẽ hơn hoặc phòng thủ

examples: It's a collection of philandering American presidents.

examples: For all of their opulence, the duo is very philanthropic.
To that end, Subaru has also become very involved in philanthropic work.
When not training for the Super Bowl or co-chairing the Met Gala, Bündchen and Brady find time to philanthropic work.

Furthermore, the wealthiest Americans live in the biggest cities, and their philanthropic efforts predominantly go to the arts institutions near where they live.
words.defineEn: of or relating to or characterized by philanthropy

words.defineVi: bộ sưu tập và nghiên cứu về tem bưu chính

examples: The floral arrangements adorned the altar, adding beauty to the church ceremony.

Yesterday, she showcased a stunning updo that was her crowning glory, adorned with delicate flowers for a special occasion.
this will adorn your torso.
words.defineEn: make more attractive by adding ornament, colour, etc.
words.defineVi: làm cho hấp dẫn hơn bằng cách thêm vật trang trí, màu sắc, v.v.

examples: It had lost customers' trust and Wall Street's adoration.
We’ve actually found him a wonderful home as a classroom pet, where he will get the dedication of a wonderful teacher who knows turtle care, and the adoration of many students.
He loves the energy and he loves the adoration that he gets from those rallies.

And so came the Giotto mission, named for the Italian painter Giotto di Bondone of the Late Middle Ages, on account of his representing the Star of Bethlehem as a comet in his painting, Adoration of the Magi.
words.defineEn: the act of showing great love or admiration, usually through gestures or actions

examples: The result of the die roll dictates a step in a different direction.
